title: Namma Metro Yellow Line Bangalore: RV Road to Bommasandra section opening on January 6? What BMRCL said - ET Now
summary:
Namma Metro Yellow Line Bangalore: RV Road to Bommasandra section opening on January 6? What BMRCL said

Updated: January 5, 2025 09:20 IST

Bengaluru's Yellow Line, connecting RV Road to Bommasandra, has generated excitement but the Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) has denied January 6, 2025, launch rumors. The first train will be unveiled on that date, with subsequent deliveries scheduled.

  • The Yellow Line will span 18.82 kilometers with 18 stations.
  • MP Tejasvi Surya confirmed the delivery schedule of trains.
  • The initial operations will feature three trains, expanding by August 2025.
“I am equally frustrated with the repeated delays in the start of the Yellow Line.” – Tejasvi Surya

The Yellow Line is anticipated to enhance connectivity in Bengaluru, especially aiding commuters to the Electronics City tech hub.
newTitle: Namma Metro Yellow Line Bangalore: RV Road to Bommasandra Section Update

Standard Glass Lining IPO Day 1 Live Updates: Issue was subscribed 13.32x as NIIs led bid; Check GMP, subscription data | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Standard Glass Lining IPO Day 1 Live Updates

Date: 6 Jan, 2025 Source: HT Digital Streams Limited

The Standard Glass Lining IPO launches today with a price band of ₹133-140 per share, aiming to raise ₹410.05 crore. The issue was subscribed 13.32x on the first day as NIIs led the bidding.

  • The IPO opened for subscription on January 6 and will close on January 8.
  • It secured ₹123 crore from anchor investors ahead of the launch.
  • Reviews indicate substantial interest, with shares trading at a ₹97 premium in the grey market.
  • The issue consists of a fresh issuance and an offer for sale of shares by promoters.
  • Proceeds will be allocated for debt repayment and investment in a subsidiary.
The NII portion led the bidding round at 25.43x, followed by retail investors at 14.46x.

In summary, the Standard Glass Lining IPO is generating significant interest, reflecting a positive market outlook.
newTitle: Standard Glass Lining IPO Day 1 Live Updates: High Demand for Initial Public Offering

title: Market Wrap, January 6: Bears roar loud and clear; SENSEX, NIFTY50 sink 1.6%; top factors behind crash today - Upstox
summary:
Market Wrap, January 6: Bears Roar Loud and Clear; SENSEX, NIFTY50 Sink 1.6%

Date: January 6, 2025   Source: Market News

Major stock market indices in India, including SENSEX and NIFTY50, experienced significant declines, driven by investor panic over a new respiratory virus scare and weak global cues.

Key Points

  • S&P BSE SENSEX closed at 77,964.99, down 1,258.12 points (1.59%)
  • NSE NIFTY50 closed at 23,616.05, down 388.70 points (1.62%)
  • Investor wealth dropped by ₹10.98 lakh crore
  • First cases of human metapneumovirus (HMPV) detected in India raised market fears
  • FII selling led to significant equity offloads worth ₹4,227.25 crore
“The outbreak of the HMPV virus unnerved investors.”

Notable Quotes:

“Volatility Index is a measure of the amount by which an underlying index is expected to fluctuate in the near term.”

Continuous selling by foreign institutional investors added to market declines, with all major sectors witnessing downturns, particularly in PSU banks.

Conclusion

The combination of new health concerns and sustained foreign selling has left Indian markets in a vulnerable position as investors brace for further volatility.
newTitle: Market Wrap, January 6: Bears Roar; SENSEX and NIFTY50 Drop Significantly

title: Stock market crash: Sensex, Nifty 50 crack over 1.5% each; HMPV virus scare among 5 factors behind selloff | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Stock market crash: Sensex, Nifty 50 crack over 1.5% each; HMPV virus scare among 5 factors behind selloff

Date: January 6, 2023

Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market saw a significant downturn on January 6, with both Sensex and Nifty 50 experiencing declines of over 1.5%. This drop was primarily triggered by fears surrounding a new virus outbreak in China, alongside weak performances from major Asian markets.

Key Points:

  • Sensex closed down 1.59% at 77,964 points; Nifty 50 down 1.6% at 23,616 points.
  • Nifty Smallcap 100 and Midcap 100 indices also dropped significantly by 3.2% and 2.7%, respectively.
  • 46 of the 50 Nifty constituents ended the day in negative territory; ITC was the biggest loser, dropping 8.1%.
  • Weakness in Asian markets, particularly impacted by potential trade tariffs from the US.
  • Concerns over the detected Human Metapneumovirus in Bengaluru tied to respiratory illness spikes in China.
  • Technical analysis shows Nifty has broken key support levels, escalating selling pressure.
“Nifty holds a good view until it stays above its 200 DMA which is placed at 23,900...” - Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd.

In conclusion, the markets are reacting negatively to multiple factors, including international cues and health alerts, signaling potential challenges ahead for investors.
newTitle: Stock Market Crash: Sensex and Nifty 50 Decline Over 1.5% Amid HMPV Virus Concerns

title: 'Bank Should Remain Vigilant' : Supreme Court Holds SBI Liable To Refund Amount To Customer Who Reported... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Bank Should Remain Vigilant: Supreme Court Holds SBI Liable To Refund Amount To Customer Who Reported...

Publication Date: Not specified Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court of India has ruled that banks, including the State Bank of India (SBI), hold responsibility for unauthorized transactions and must ensure they safeguard their customers. The court emphasized that account holders also need to be vigilant and refrain from sharing one-time passwords (OTPs).

  • The SBI was held liable for a fraudulent transaction totaling ₹94,204.80 that was reported by a customer.
  • The customer was a victim of fraud after sharing sensitive information under the pretense of customer support.
  • The High Court had previously directed SBI to refund the amount, a decision upheld by the Supreme Court.
  • RBI guidelines state zero liability for customers in cases of data breaches, if reported promptly.
  • The court stressed the importance of banks using advanced technology to prevent such fraudulent activities.
“All transactions relating to the account of the respondent No.1... were found to be unauthorized and fraudulent. It is the responsibility of the bank so far as such unauthorized and fraudulent transactions are concerned.”

The court concluded that customers must remain vigilant, recognizing their role in preventing unauthorized access while also ensuring that banks take appropriate measures to secure customer accounts.
newTitle: Supreme Court Upholds SBI's Liability in Fraudulent Transaction Case

title: THIS small-cap stock below ₹50 declares 5:1 bonus shares; do you own? | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Small-cap Stock Gujarat Toolroom Declares 5:1 Bonus Shares

Publication Date: Not Specified Source: Live Mint

The Gujarat Toolroom board has approved a 5:1 bonus issue, which will reward shareholders with five additional shares for every share owned. However, member approval is still needed.

The bonus shares are expected to be credited by March 6, 2025, increasing the company's paid-up share capital significantly.

  • The company will utilize ₹116 crore from its securities premium account and retained earnings.
  • Gujarat Toolroom’s share capital will rise from ₹23.20 crore to ₹139.23 crore.
  • The company reported a 1,016% year-on-year growth in quarterly net profit.
  • Sales rose by 72.65% in the same quarter.
  • Gujarat Toolroom raised ₹95.66 crore through a Qualified Institutional Placement (QIP).
“Gujarat Toolroom is dedicated to rewarding its investors.”

This bonus share declaration reflects a commitment to growth and investor confidence, bolstered by strong financial results.
newTitle: Small-cap Stock Gujarat Toolroom Declares 5:1 Bonus Shares

HPCL and IOC Shares Drop Amid Rising Crude Oil Prices

Date: January 6, 2024 Source: CNBC TV18

Shares of oil marketing companies fell sharply as crude oil prices continue to climb, leading to significant declines for HPCL, BPCL, and IOC.

  • HPCL shares tumbled 6% to ₹388.50.
  • BPCL shares decreased by 4% to ₹285.60.
  • IOC shares fell 3.99% to ₹132.63.
  • Brent crude is currently priced at $76.30 per barrel, with WTI at $73.77.
  • India Ratings maintains a 'neutral' outlook on the oil and gas sector for FY26.
  • Low crude prices are expected to impact upstream earnings, but margins should remain healthy.
"This would keep sufficient cushion in margin, with an estimated break-even cost of production at $40-45 a barrel, leaving Ebitda of $20-30 per barrel."

The ongoing rise in crude oil prices has led to immediate declines in oil marketing company shares, prompting observations about future pricing and production implications.

title: 'Real money is with...' - Zerodha's Nithin Kamath names 2 cities behind 80% of equity delivery trades - One is Mumbai, other is… - ET Now
summary:
Zerodha's Nithin Kamath Names Key Cities in Equity Trading

Date & Source: Updated Jan 6, 2025, ET Now News

Leading stock broker Zerodha's CEO Nithin Kamath has revealed that Ahmedabad and Mumbai together account for 80% of equity delivery trades in India. This highlights a significant shift in trading dynamics, despite Gujarat's strong trading history.

  • Ahmedabad and Mumbai account for 80% of equity delivery trades.
  • Gujarat, though historically active in trading, now represents only 8% of total registered investors.
  • Maharashtra had the highest number of registered investors in the current fiscal year.
“Essentially, the real money is with Gujjus.” - Nithin Kamath

This information indicates the changing landscape of equity trading in India, as traditional strongholds like Gujarat face a decline in registered investor share.
newTitle: Zerodha's Nithin Kamath Highlights Key Cities in Equity Delivery Trades

Tata Motors Ends Maruti Suzuki’s 40-Year Run As Maker Of India’s Best-Selling Car - NDTV Profit
summary:
Tata Motors Ends Maruti Suzuki’s 40-Year Run As Maker Of India’s Best-Selling Car

Publication Date: January 6, 2025 | Source: Bloomberg Quint

The Tata Punch has become India’s best-selling car in 2024, ending a 40-year streak for Maruti Suzuki, which dominated the market for decades.

  • The Tata Punch outsold all other models, including Maruti Suzuki's WagonR and Ertiga.
  • It was the only vehicle to exceed 200,000 units sold in 2024.
  • Consumer preferences in India have shifted significantly towards sub-compact SUVs.
  • Overall car sales in India increased by nearly 28% from 2018 to 2024.
The Tata Punch topped the chart with 2.02 lakh sold units. Maruti Suzuki's WagonR and Ertiga were the runner-ups, with sales of around 1.9 lakh units.

This shift in consumer preference towards larger vehicles may indicate a long-term change in the automotive landscape in India.
newTitle: Tata Motors Overtakes Maruti Suzuki in Car Sales

title: Infosys Postpones Salary Hikes; Know IT Company's Plan On Pay Increment - News18
summary:
Infosys Postpones Salary Hikes; Know IT Company's Plan On Pay Increment

Date: January 06, 2025 Source: News18

Infosys, India’s second-largest IT services company, has decided to postpone its annual salary hikes to the fourth quarter of FY25 due to ongoing challenges in the global market.

  • The previous salary revisions occurred in November 2023.
  • Some increments will take effect in January, with others in April 2025.
  • Major IT players like HCLTech and LTIMindtree are also deferring pay raises to maintain profitability.
  • Infosys reported a 2.2% sequential increase in net profit but fell short of market expectations.
  • Project Maximus aims to enhance operational profitability and is crucial for margin management.
“Despite the absence of immediate pay revisions, analysts predict the company’s margins may face pressure in the December quarter.”

The postponement of salary hikes highlights the significant impact of macroeconomic factors on the IT sector, with many employees viewing job retention as a major advantage in the current economic climate.
newTitle: Infosys Postpones Salary Hikes; Know IT Company's Plan On Pay Increment

title: Unveiling the new Škoda Enyaq: World Premiere this Wednesday - ŠKODA Storyboard
ITC Demerger: Analysts remain optimistic amid strategic restructuring, see up to 29% upside potential in shares | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
ITC Demerger: Analysts remain optimistic amid strategic restructuring, see up to 29% upside potential in shares

Date: January 6, 2025   Source: Live Mint

The Indian conglomerate ITC has initiated the separation of its hotel business, with shares now trading ex-demerger. This strategic move aims to unlock value for shareholders, and analysts are projecting significant upside in ITC shares.

Key Points:

  • Demerger Ratio: Shareholders will receive one ITC Hotels share for every ten ITC shares held.
  • Index Impact: ITC Hotels will become part of the Nifty 50 and the Sensex.
  • Stock Price Adjustments: ITC shares adjusted to ₹455.60 on the NSE post-demerger.
  • Financial Strength: ITC Hotels starts with ₹1,500 crore in cash.
  • Strategic Initiatives: The company plans major expansions and hotel openings in the coming years.

Notable Quotes:

“The demerger is a significant strategic step, positioning ITC Hotels as an independent hospitality player.”

Analysts expect the demerger to enhance return ratios and improve ITC's overall performance.

B&K Securities has projected a fair value of ₹145 for ITC Hotels, while Centrum Broking set a price target of ₹583, highlighting the benefits of the reorganization.

Conclusion:

The demerger marks an important milestone for ITC, allowing a sharper focus on its core hospitality business and presenting a strong growth outlook.
newTitle: ITC Demerger: Analysts remain optimistic amid strategic restructuring, see up to 29% upside potential in shares

The broader markets traded in the red, with significant declines noticed in the NIFTY50 and BSE SENSEX indices, while the volatility index, India VIX, surged.

Exclusive: Chinese exchanges ask big fund managers to restrict stock selling - Reuters
summary:
Exclusive: Chinese exchanges ask big fund managers to restrict stock selling

Date: January 6, 2025 | Source: Reuters

Chinese stock exchanges have requested major mutual funds to limit stock selling as part of efforts to stabilize the market heading into a challenging economic period.

  • The Shanghai and Shenzhen exchanges called on at least four large mutual funds to buy more stocks than they sell each day.
  • This comes amid significant losses for Chinese stocks at the start of 2025 due to market fears over potential U.S. tariffs.
  • The CSI 300 Index fell 2.9% on the first trading day of the year, marking its worst New Year start since 2016.
  • Authorities have implemented several measures to shore up market confidence, including significant financial aid for stock purchases.
"Such guidance has a tendency to become regular," a source noted about previous similar requests.

In conclusion, the measures taken by Chinese exchanges represent a proactive strategy to mitigate market anxiety and promote stability during uncertain economic times.
newTitle: Chinese Exchanges Urge Fund Managers to Limit Stock Sales Amid Market Concerns
